Kent Beck wrote:

> Re: code that throws exceptions. I prefer to declare the test case as
> throwing the exception. I haven't ever had trouble debugging from the
> information provided in the exception. Discarding that exception and getting
> a generic AssertionError seems a step backwards to me.

How often have you wished your test verified data stored in the expected 
exception? Ever? This is the one bit that surprises me, because I often 
want to check more than merely catching an instanceof the expected type. 
Can you think of a time when you would have preferred, in retrospect, to 
have checked more than just the exception type? I imagine not frequently 
enough to matter to you, judging only by what I've seen you write on the 
subject.
